intro: Trichospermum samoense, commonly known as the Samoan milk tree, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Trichospermum samoense is adapted to coastal environments and can tolerate salt spray, making it a hardy species in tropical climates.
